responsibilities: Contribute to the vision of enabling intelligent systems for end users, internal stakeholders, and external partners.
Solve challenging problems at the intersection of developing models and the infrastructure needed to operationalize them at scale.
Manage the full life-cycle of machine learning, including data labeling/collection/management, model development, and deploying to large-scale production settings.
Collaborate closely with backend, devops, and data engineers on focused teams.
Build predictive tools and models to enhance user experience and provide insights for partners.
skills: Solid foundation of fundamental or object-oriented programming skills, with a focus on Python.
Experience building and/or training ML models using a Python Framework, such as PyTorch or TensorFlow.
Experience deploying applications to a public cloud environment (e.g. AWS).
Experience with test writing and quality assurance methodologies.
Passion for tackling challenging and ambiguous problems in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to effectively communicate across a variety of technical and nontechnical audiences.
Desire to grow software engineering skills through collaboration, open communication, direct feedback, and knowledge sharing.
qualifications: Ability to work full-time (40 hours per week) from either one of Fetchâ€™s offices or remotely, in the United States, for a fixed term of 12-16 weeks.
The apprenticeship program is not intended for students who are actively enrolled in a full-time, degree-seeking program.
Due to the short-term nature of this role, Fetch is not able to transfer existing H1Bs or support new applications for the FY 2026 lottery.
